name: adb

inheritedOptions.description: listen on all network interfaces, not just localhost
use USB device (error if multiple devices connected)
use TCP/IP device (error if multiple TCP/IP devices available)
use device with given transport id
listen on given socket for adb server [default=tcp:localhost:5037]

subcommands.name: devices
subcommands.description: list connected devices

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: show this help message

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: show version num

subcommands.name: connect
subcommands.description: connect to a device via TCP/IP

subcommands.name: diconnect
subcommands.description: disconnect from given TCP/IP device [default port=5555], or all

subcommands.name: forward
subcommands.description: forward socket connection using
subcommands.usage:
adb forward --list
adb forward [--no-rebind] LOCAL REMOTE
adb forward --remove LOCAL
adb forward --remove-all

subcommands.name: ppp
subcommands.description: run PPP over USB

subcommands.name: reverse
subcommands.description: reverse socket connection
subcommands.usage:
adb reverse --list
adb reverse [--no-rebind] REMOTE LOCAL
adb reverse --remove REMOTE
adb reverse --remove-all

options.description: list all reverse socket connections from device
remove all reverse socket connections from device

subcommands.name: push
subcommands.description: copy local files/directories to device

options.description: only push files that are newer on the host than the device

subcommands.name: pull
subcommands.description: copy files/dirs from device

subcommands.name: sync
subcommands.description: sync a local build from $ANDROID_PRODUCT_OUT to the device (default all)

subcommands.name: shell
subcommands.description: run remote shell command (interactive shell if no command given)

options.description: disable remote exit codes and stdout/stderr separation

subcommands.name: emu
subcommands.description: run emulator console command

subcommands.name: install
subcommands.description: push package to the device and install them

options.description: allow version code downgrade (debuggable packages only)
cause the app to be installed as an ephemeral install app
always push APK to device and invoke Package Manager as separate steps
force streaming APK directly into Package Manager
force update of deployment agent when using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version is newer and using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version has different version code and using fast deploy
locate agent files from local source build (instead of SDK location)

subcommands.name: install-multiple
subcommands.description: push packages to the device and install them

options.description: allow version code downgrade (debuggable packages only)
cause the app to be installed as an ephemeral install app
always push APK to device and invoke Package Manager as separate steps
force streaming APK directly into Package Manager
force update of deployment agent when using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version is newer and using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version has different version code and using fast deploy
locate agent files from local source build (instead of SDK location)

subcommands.name: install-multi-package
subcommands.description: push one or more packages to the device and install them atomically

options.description: allow version code downgrade (debuggable packages only)
cause the app to be installed as an ephemeral install app
always push APK to device and invoke Package Manager as separate steps
force streaming APK directly into Package Manager
force update of deployment agent when using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version is newer and using fast deploy
update deployment agent when local version has different version code and using fast deploy
locate agent files from local source build (instead of SDK location)

subcommands.name: uninstall
subcommands.description: remove this app package from the device

options.description: keep the data and cache directories

subcommands.name: bugreport
subcommands.description: write bugreport to given PATH

subcommands.name: jdwp
subcommands.description: list pids of processes hosting a JDWP transport

subcommands.name: logcat
subcommands.description: show device log

subcommands.name: disable-verify
subcommands.description: disable dm-verity checking on userdebug builds

subcommands.name: enable-verify
subcommands.description: re-enable dm-verity checking on userdebug builds

subcommands.name: keygen
subcommands.description: generate adb public/private key; private key stored in FILE, public key stored in FILE.pub (existing files overwritten)

subcommands.name: wait-for-device
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (device)

subcommands.name: wait-for-usb-device
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (device)

subcommands.name: wait-for-local-device
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (device)

subcommands.name: wait-for-recovery
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (recovery)

subcommands.name: wait-for-usb-recovery
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (recovery)

subcommands.name: wait-for-local-recovery
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (recovery)

subcommands.name: wait-for-sideload
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (sideload)

subcommands.name: wait-for-usb-sideload
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (sideload)

subcommands.name: wait-for-local-sideload
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (sideload)

subcommands.name: wait-for-bootloader
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (bootloader)

subcommands.name: wait-for-usb-bootloader
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (bootloader)

subcommands.name: wait-for-local-bootloader
subcommands.description: wait for device to be in the given state (bootloader)

subcommands.name: get-state
subcommands.description: print offline | bootloader | device

subcommands.name: get-serialno
subcommands.description: print <serial-number>

subcommands.name: get-devpath
subcommands.description: print <device-path>

subcommands.name: remount
subcommands.description: remount /system, /vendor, and /oem partitions read-write

subcommands.name: reboot
subcommands.description: reboot the device; defaults to booting system image but supports bootloader and recovery too. sideload reboots into recovery and automatically starts sideload mode, sideload-auto-reboot is the same but reboots after sideloading.

subcommands.name: sideload
subcommands.description: sideload the given full OTA package

subcommands.name: root
subcommands.description: restart adbd with root permissions

subcommands.name: unroot
subcommands.description: restart adbd without root permissions

subcommands.name: usb
subcommands.description: restart adb server listening on USB

subcommands.name: tcpip
subcommands.description: restart adb server listening on TCP on PORT

subcommands.name: start-server
subcommands.description: ensure that there is a server running

subcommands.name: kill-server
subcommands.description: kill the server if it is running

subcommands.name: reconnect
subcommands.usage:
adb reconnect
adb reconnect device
adb reconnect offline
subcommands.description: kick connection from host side to force reconnect

subcommands.name: device
subcommands.description: kick connection from device side to force reconnect

subcommands.name: offline
subcommands.description: reset offline/unauthorized devices to force reconnect

tldr:
> Android Debug Bridge: communicate with an Android emulator instance or connected Android devices.
> Some subcommands such as `adb shell` have their own usage documentation.
> More information: <https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb>.

- Check whether the adb server process is running and start it:

`adb start-server`

- Terminate the adb server process:

`adb kill-server`

- Start a remote shell in the target emulator/device instance:

`adb shell`

- Push an Android application to an emulator/device:

`adb install -r {{path/to/file.apk}}`

- Copy a file/directory from the target device:

`adb pull {{path/to/device_file_or_directory}} {{path/to/local_destination_directory}}`

- Copy a file/directory to the target device:

`adb push {{path/to/local_file_or_directory}} {{path/to/device_destination_directory}}`

- Get a list of connected devices:

`adb devices`
